page.title: 01Eskadale Invernes-Shire
page.content: The E quarter is clothedd in Scots Pine & Spruce, an important source of employment. To the W & S all is heather dominated moorland & upland crags, culminating in the heights of Meall Mor (402m) in the S. Along the N edge is a band of deciduous woodland, consisting of Rowan, Ash & Silver Birch. In the NE corner, sandwiched between the deciduous & coniferous woodlands, is a belt of rough grazing which feeds sheep and beef cattle. At the very N edge is the hamlet of Eskadale, where there is a RC Church and a small hatchery. The latter handles 200,000 salmon per year, which are released into Scottish waters. Running through Eskadale, E to W is a minor road (single track with pass in places). Another road crosses this section, running from NE to SW. Again it has passing places
